checkTypeArg

private void checkTypeArg(java.lang.Class type, java.lang.annotation.Annotation ann)
Checks whether a TypeArg annotation matches the given type. If it doesn't, an exception is thrown.
Parameters:
type - The type to check the annotation against. Should either implement Collection or Map.
ann - The TypeArg annotation to check.

endTypeArgComment

private void endTypeArgComment(java.lang.Object output)
' } /** Writes the end of a javadoc comment to the given output.

generateInterfaces

void generateInterfaces(java.lang.Class serviceClass)
Creates the required service and async interfaces for a given Grails service. This checks to make sure that neither interface file has been modified since they were last generated. If either has, then the generation is skipped - we don't want to overwrite user changes.
Parameters:
serviceWrapper - (GrailsClass) The Grails service's class.
packageName - (String) The GWT client package in which to put the interfaces.
log - The plugin logger.

generateInterfaces

getOutputDir

getPackage

java.lang.String getPackage(java.lang.Class serviceClass)
Determines whether the given service has been configured for GWT RPC, and if so returns the package in which the corresponding interfaces should be generated. If the package is specified in the expose list using the "gwt:" notation, then that package is returned. Otherwise, this returns the package of the given service class.
Parameters:
serviceClass - The Grails service to query.
Returns:
The fully-qualified name of the package in which to put the generated interfaces, or null if the expose list does not contain an entry for GWT.

getType

protected java.lang.String getType(java.lang.Class clazz)
Returns the string representation of the given type. For example, 'java.lang.String', 'int', 'java.lang.String[]', 'boolean[][][]'.

handleTypeArg

private void handleTypeArg(java.lang.Object output, java.lang.reflect.Method method)
Checks for any TypeArg annotations on a given method and writes the appropriate javadoc with '@gwt.typeArgs' tags if necessary.
Parameters:
output - (output stream, string buffer) The stream or buffer to write the javadoc to. The only requirement is that is supports the '<<' operator.
method - The method definition to process.

isGwtExposed

boolean isGwtExposed(java.lang.Class serviceClass)

startTypeArgComment

private void startTypeArgComment(java.lang.Object output)
Writes the start of a javadoc comment to the given output.

writeInterfaces

protected void writeInterfaces(java.lang.Class serviceClass, java.lang.String packageName, java.lang.Object mainOutput, java.lang.Object asyncOutput)

writeTypeArgEntry

private void writeTypeArgEntry(java.lang.Object output, java.lang.annotation.Annotation ann, java.lang.String paramName)
Writes a '@gwt.typeArgs' javadoc entry for the given annotation and parameter name.
Parameters:
output - (stream, buffer) The output to write the entry to. The only requirement is that it implements the '<<' operator.
ann - The TypeArg annotation to generate the GWT javadoc tag for.
paramName - The parameter name as specified in the corresponding method signature. Use null if the tag corresponds to a return type.
